examples: Her family is English to the core.
The English test was no problem for Pedro.
The full English breakfast included a generous portion of black pudding alongside eggs, bacon, and beans.
I can count up to fifty in English.
I read English at Oxford.
words.defineEn: belonging or relating to England, its people, or language
words.defineVi: thuộc về hoặc liên quan đến nước Anh, con người hoặc ngôn ngữ của nước này

examples: They divided the grapefruit into equal segments to share among the group.
Let line AB be equal to line CD.
This law will help small businesses to compete on equal terms with large multinational corporations.
We want to ensure that women can take part on an equal footing to men.
My father always taught me that a fair exchange is no robbery, and that both sides should feel they got equal value in a transaction.
words.defineEn: having the same amount, size, quantity, etc.
words.defineVi: có cùng số lượng, kích thước, số lượng, v.v.

examples: The wool feels soft.
The soft rug in the living room adds warmth to the space.
The full moon cast a soft glow on the landscape.
The soft carpet feels nice under my feet.
As the Camembert matured, the cheese rind turned soft and bloomy.
words.defineEn: easily changing shape when touched; not firm or hard to the touch
words.defineVi: dễ dàng thay đổi hình dạng khi chạm vào; không cứng hoặc khó chạm vào

examples: The railway line runs right past the house.
The clock says ten past two.
Not a single jot or tittle goes past the eye of the boss without her noticing.
The cat ran right past me and into the house.
His past comes back to hunt him when an old friend returns to his life.
words.defineEn: existing before the present time
words.defineVi: tồn tại trước thời điểm hiện tại

examples: Foreign car manufacturers have made inroads into the European market.
The college runs summer courses for foreign students.
I've had it with foreign holidays.
He traveled to a foreign country where horseflesh was considered a delicacy.
Every so often, Claire has itchy feet and sets off for a foreign destination.
words.defineEn: in, from, or characteristic of a country or language other than one's own
words.defineVi: trong, từ, hoặc đặc trưng của một quốc gia hoặc ngôn ngữ không phải của chính mình

examples: His help is useful as a chocolate teapot.
These experiments serve no useful purpose.
Thanks for the information, it was very useful.
It was time to see if Sam was just blowing smoke or if he actually had some useful information for us.
This umbrella is stuck inside out, so it's about as useful as a chocolate teapot right now.
words.defineEn: providing help when we want to get or do something
words.defineVi: cung cấp trợ giúp khi chúng tôi muốn nhận hoặc làm điều gì đó

examples: His time in the 25-meter freestyle set a national record.
The bald eagle is a national symbol of the American people.
Canada celebrates its national day, Canada Day, on July 1st.
Tax rises have made some inroads into the country's national debt.
He appeared on national television to deny the claims.
words.defineEn: relating to a particular nation or country
words.defineVi: liên quan đến một quốc gia hoặc quốc gia cụ thể

examples: My job is the tough one.
The boss is very tough on anyone who steps out of line.
She is made of tougher stuff.
The team's defense is a tough nut to crack.
Long hours and tough working conditions are often par for the course in catering.
words.defineEn: difficult to achieve or deal with
words.defineVi: khó khăn để đạt được hoặc đối phó với

examples: "That boy isn't very bright."
These shrubs produce bright red berries.
The bird had bright feathers and a long beak.
Some bright spark left the tap running all night.
I arrived bright and early at Brian the falconer's house for day one of my course.
words.defineEn: producing a lot of light
words.defineVi: tạo ra nhiều ánh sáng

examples: They have to put up with a giant oil refinery right on their doorstep.
Last year my son discovered a giant runner bean in his garden and couldn't wait to show it off to his friends.
Standing on the shoulders of giants is a necessary part of creativity
Frank knew he was just a cog in the wheel of this giant corporation.
Giant retail chains are pricing locally owned shops out of the market all over the country.
words.defineEn: extremely large in size or importance
words.defineVi: cực kỳ lớn về kích thước hoặc tầm quan trọng

examples: The water feels warm.
Are you warm enough?
It's quite warm outside.
The afternoon sun casts a warm glow on the buildings and trees.
The season of summer brings warm weather and longer days.
words.defineEn: having a temperature that is high but not hot, especially in a way that is enjoyable and pleasant
words.defineVi: có nhiệt độ cao nhưng không nóng, đặc biệt là theo cách thú vị và dễ chịu

examples: The milk skin gives a unique texture to the homemade pudding.
The briny taste of olives adds a unique twist to my homemade pizza.
The natural tanginess of tamarind adds a unique twist to sauces, marinades, and soups.
Cheshire cheese has a unique flavor profile.
The unique flavor of physalis pairs wonderfully with dark chocolate in desserts.
words.defineEn: being one of a kind, with no equal
words.defineVi: là một trong những loại, không có bình đẳng

examples: Retirement often brings with it a massive drop in income.
I had a massive argument with Sue, but at least it has cleared the air.
The CEO of the company was paid a massive salary, while the workers who actually produced the products were paid minimum wage and had no job security.
For our first entrepreneurial venture, we decided to cross the stream where it is shallowest by starting small and local rather than taking on a massive nationwide project initially.
The U.S. market is massive.
words.defineEn: extremely large, heavy, or solid
words.defineVi: cực kỳ lớn, nặng hoặc rắn

examples: The hotel provides fresh towels for the guests every day.
They served fresh vegetables with a side of tangy salad cream.
The farmer harvested the fresh broccoli florets from the garden for market.
She juices fresh vegetables every morning for a nutritious start to her day.
I made a fresh salad with mixed greens, goat cheese, and a handful of red currants.
words.defineEn: new or different and not formerly known or used
words.defineVi: mới hoặc khác và chưa được biết đến hoặc sử dụng trước đây

examples: Her recent conduct is beyond the pale.
Sales have lost steam in recent weeks.
The company's recent collapse has left their pension fund members up the creek.
The recent strike has put the airline company in a tight spot.
The most recent incident happened only a week ago.
words.defineEn: having happened, started, or been done only a short time ago
words.defineVi: đã xảy ra, bắt đầu, hoặc được thực hiện chỉ một thời gian ngắn trước đây

examples: Look alive!
Surprisingly, the quiet neighborhood came alive with vibrant festivities during the annual festival.
Everyone would've ate him alive if he went for it and failed.
Look alive boys we got a lot to do.
Let us know you're alive
words.defineEn: not dead; living
words.defineVi: không chết; cuộc sống

examples: The cruise went very quickly.
Generally, the article reads very well.
The car holds the corners very well.
Her condition is very serious.
The design is very basic.
words.defineEn: used to emphasize that one is talking about the exact same person or thing and not about anyone or anything else
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để nhấn mạnh rằng một người đang nói về cùng một người hoặc vật chứ không phải về bất kỳ ai hoặc bất cứ điều gì khác

examples: The mother gently cleaned her baby's ears with a cotton swab.
A new broom sweeps clean, after all.
Sarah cleans the kitchen counters with a sponge.
She had to clean her dirty car after a long road trip.
She cleans the dining room after each meal.
words.defineEn: not having any stains, bacteria, marks, or dirt
words.defineVi: không có bất kỳ vết bẩn, vi khuẩn, dấu vết hoặc bụi bẩn

examples: My friend is afraid he might go down with the flu.
I’m afraid I’ll have to pass on that offer of coffee.
I'm afraid I have to disagree with your interpretation of the data.
I was afraid he was going to hit me.
I'm afraid I'm a bad dancer.
words.defineEn: getting a bad and anxious feeling from a person or thing because we think something bad or dangerous will happen
words.defineVi: nhận được một cảm giác tồi tệ và lo lắng từ một người hoặc một vật bởi vì chúng tôi nghĩ điều gì đó tồi tệ hoặc nguy hiểm sẽ xảy ra

examples: That contest wasn't fair!
The food was fair to middling.
Everyone should have a fair slice of the cake.
All of his teachers are going bananas over his science fair experiment.
They were fair people before it went to their heads.
words.defineEn: relatively large in number, amount, or size
words.defineVi: tương đối lớn về số lượng, số lượng hoặc kích thước

examples: The two sides in the dispute are finally willing to talk.
I'm willing to accept the blame for what happened.
I'm willing to accept some minor edits on my script, but I draw a line at any major rewrites.
Kate is willing to pay full price for an expensive handbag, but I just can't wrap my head around that.
Look, I was willing to take a chance on your idea, but it didn't pan out.
words.defineEn: eager, interested, or ready to do something
words.defineVi: háo hức, quan tâm, hoặc sẵn sàng để làm một cái gì đó

examples: Are you feeling comfortable?
He always wears comfortable clothes when he goes for a run.
He likes the comfortable seats and big screen at the movie theater.
The room had a comfortable bed where she could rest.
The rug in front of the fireplace provides a comfortable spot to sit.
words.defineEn: physically feeling relaxed and not feeling pain, stress, fear, etc.
words.defineVi: thể chất cảm thấy thoải mái và không cảm thấy đau đớn, căng thẳng, sợ hãi, v.v.

examples: On the credit side, the restaurant offers a wide range of choices.
The talented actor effortlessly portrayed a wide range of characters, from a hero to a villain.
The fast runner won the race by a wide margin.
Italy's Mediterranean climate and diverse geography offer a wide range of outdoor activities
The furniture store has a wide section of sofas, tables, and chairs.
words.defineEn: having a large length from side to side
words.defineVi: có chiều dài lớn từ bên này sang bên kia

examples: This policy is no longer an effective means to an end.
Identifying a specific segment of the market as our target will be more effective than a shotgun approach.
Researchers found this to be the most effective method.
A new study is casting doubt on the once popular narrative that N95 masks are more effective than surgical masks.
The research appears to show that the drug is effective in most cases.
words.defineEn: achieving the intended or desired result
words.defineVi: đạt được kết quả dự định hoặc mong muốn

examples: Traditional stores are now pursuing a bricks and clicks strategy.
In these traditional stories, no crime goes unpunished.
Traditional parents used to believe in laying down the law for their offspring.
Iceland moss is commonly used in traditional Scandinavian cuisine
The traditional English breakfast included a generous portion of kippers, served alongside eggs and bacon.
words.defineEn: belonging to or following the methods or thoughts that are old as opposed to new or different ones
words.defineVi: thuộc về hoặc tuân theo các phương pháp hoặc suy nghĩ cũ trái ngược với những phương pháp hoặc suy nghĩ mới hoặc khác
